subject: p12185775
History: Hypoxia, needing chest x-ray to assess trajectory of pulmonary disease.
Findings: In comparison with the study of, there is continued enlargement of the cardiac silhouette. Pulmonary vascularity is mildly engorged but less prominent than on the previous study. Opacification at the bases with obscuration of the hemidiaphragms is consistent with bilateral layering effusions, more prominent on the left, with underlying compressive atelectasis. Central catheter tip again extends to the upper to mid portion of the SVC.
